name: whiteturtle
text: Onstad once again makes a cartoon cat seem more human than any television character ever made ever.

name: ravindra108
text:
Chubbied for the avatar.

Come for me G'mork! I am Atreyu!

Also chubbied for the comment, but as I can only chubby once, you'll have to share.

name: soticoto
text: Gotta say... this is the only time I've ever given a strip a 5 for something other than being hilariously funny.  Beef seems to have worked things out in his mind, and it works for him.

name: darkwaffle
text: A comment left by darkwaffle was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DR_MANFLESH_DESIRES_ANAL_PLAY_IMMEDIATELY, tttt2, tehloki)

name: ghoti
text:
You mean "for the 8th time for the first time."

Syntax: it's your friend!

name: wrmeade
text: This is one of my favorite phrases in the whole strip.

name: hoarday4
text: Dude was right in the first place. Don't correct people when there's no correcting to be done. Hell of uncool.

name: panthera3000
text: Said by Busey himself

name: dondoran
text: The first time the 8th time occurs is the worst.

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: this gave me good life feelings

name: hipjiverobot
text:
This is the strip that got me hooked on Achewood.

What's great about it is that it isn't especially funny, it's just about a regular guy trying to find a way to express his feelings.

name: gournal
text:
gooood feeling
won't you
stay
with
me
just a little longer

text: She always seemed more interested in Teodor than Ray in my mind. Felt like there was a thing in the air there.

text: Say NO to fan fiction.

text: Oh god no. I'm getting visions of a person scrolling through fanfiction.net and there on the screen is 'RayxBeef'.

text: I, too, never need to see this.

text: I'd grow jaded to it, eventually. Like the time I browsed the Animaniacs section of Aerisdies.

name: backspac
text: Do you like The Cure for real?

name: noah_j
text:
come on now, you know 97% of the people railin' on the cure hereabouts only do it cause chris told you to.

let's all just make some cracks about jet and get on with our lives.

name: deusoma
text: It's true! I have no feelings on The Cure one way or the other!

name: orvel
text: No opinion!

name: firesign
text: Heh yeah, at least the Cure didn't completely rip off Iggy Pop's "Lust for Life" for their only big hit...

name: noah_j
text: exactly!

name: tekende
text:
Whoa.

I never noticed the similarity before.

name: fatcat
text:
You're thinking of Jet.

The Cure are one of the better alt-rock bands out there, despite being unbelievably 80s.

name: rowboat
text:
Quote:
let's all just make some cracks about jet and get on with our lives.


Yes. Yes, he was thinking of Jet.

name: peng33
text: the cure really don't have a 'one big hit', they had a few songs that are fairly well known... which one were you referring to?

name: rowboat
text: Goddamn it. He was talking about Jet.

name: luckypyjamas
text: i do like the cure for real

name: firesign
text: Indeed. Not blindly a favorite band as a rule for me, but "Killing an Arab", "Burn", the whole "Boys Don't Cry"/"Three Imaginary Boys" album... these are good songs. As a fellow acheworld music geek, I find myself agreeng with you on many things as I trawl the archives...

name: luckypyjamas
text:
pornography, head on the door

case closed

name: fatcat
text: Disintegration? Bloodflowers?

name: luckypyjamas
text: ok can't have pornography without disintegration and bloodflowers. just picking out my favorite cure albums is difficult

name: achilleselbow
text: I'm pretty sure Onstad does as well. Ray hates The Cure because they are pretty much the opposite of hip-hop, and Onstad has let it slip on occasion that he hates hip-hop. And Teodor likes The Cure.

name: nbgreene
text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by CottonPluff, solobuttons, rachel)

name: gethen
text: Teodor is short and sweaty, and meets girls in internet chat rooms.  I guarantee you that Molly "thinks of him like a brother" and assures him that one day he will meet the right person and make a wonderful husband.

name: farqussus
text: you were right to use 'person', and not specify.

name: lateadopter
text: The blog that worried me was when she lingered in Whole Foods because of the tasty-looking man in her aisle.

name: m3funkyb
text: a lady will look, and a man will too, no reason to get worked up about it

name: riazm
text: Agreed, I never thought she'd stray from her man, I'm just saying is all. I think there was a blog where Beef got kind of overprotective of her but I don't feel like hunting it down right now.

name: riazm
text:
I'm a liar
Here is the blog entry.

She hugs Teodor and Beef absolutely fights a country and western band.

name: spinynorman
text: Fuck, how did I miss that entry! Thank you for that!

name: fosters
text: ...and Lyle saves their relationship with his mad mechanical bull riding skills. Damn, I need to start reading the blogs.

name: evolume
text: The streetlights in my town are more like, "Muuuuuuhhhhh*Bzzt*muuuuhhhhh*Bzzt*muuuuuuhhhhh"  But then, I'm from Seattle and maybe we have more moths.

name: chaesar
text:
Good call, I had no idea what that Z with a string of consecutive Rs was. [chub]

Pennsylvania lights are like a slow trance, like: nnnnnnnnnnNNNNNNNNNNNNNN

name: bacter
text: In Chicago you get kind of a GzzZZzzzzZZttt

name: vincentkv
text: When it's REALLY cold in MN, it's all "GNEEEEEEEEEEE"

name: straw
text: How they sound in the comic is basically how they sound in Maine so

name: deovalente
text: This entire thread about the local dialects of street lights is very real and awesome and I appreciate it.

name: natjo1986
text: I feel good for Beef. I mean dude just came to realization that nobody could pressure him in to doing what he's thinking about doing, he had to come to that conclusion on his own. I'm rootin for you Beef.

name: fosters
text: Not for neonfreon. He's still in that "girls are icky" stage of adolescence, so of course this arc made the little man uncomfortable. Someday he'll understand!

name: klaus
text: Jesus Christ. Onstad you are the master of words. Seriously, Roast Beef's words were just beautiful in this strip. They could be song lyrics. And what a great final decision. OH SHIT, indeed; you're getting married Roast Beef.

name: halofyre
text: Guys, does this mean Beef will be happy now?

name: relaxing
text:
Beef will still be the same dude. He's just opened himself to a new set of experiences. Some of which may result in happiness, some not.

He'll be a regular man doing regular things.

name: _cheesekayke
text: This sounds like something Philippe would say.

name: omnidope
text: Beef's smile of recognition in panel 8 is amazing- it's the sign of a good life decision made with perfect self-understanding. Fuck you, Dr. Phil.

name: lateadopter
text: It's nice to see Beef start to overcome his self-defeating inclinations for a change.  Even if he does get his heart broken somehow, he was able to hear the wise advice of his friends, and now it looks like he will act on it.  Yay!

name: lawdog
text: Beef has now taken The Walk.  Makes me all nostalgic. Best "OHHH SHIIIIIT" of a person's life right there.

name: teknofatcat
text: I love this strip... Beef all figuring out why he should get married. Makes me want to get married.

name: keithcozz
text: This one is actually beautiful.

name: count_clock
text: DO THE RIGHT THING made me laugh out loud.

name: goocifer
text:
So is Madrid like a hotel or club somewhere?

Also, "First time somebody forgets to pay the water bill for the eighth time" is one of my favorite achewood lines.

name: deathpiano
text: This is, for some reason, one of my absolute favorite strips. Not because it makes me laugh so hard it hurts, like others have, but the way Beef expresses himself is just so damn on . It never ceases to amaze me how such a surreal comic can be so spot on in terms of observations of how people think. Someday, I will purchase a signed copy of this one.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Shoe in for top five.
I don't think I could pick a favorite, but if I could it may be this one.

name: luckypyjamas
text: why is this not a 5?

name: eatmorekix
text:
just gonna post that

it makes me want to run away with my man and come back with a certificate and a baby

name: chachibenji
text: It is a cry of realization and that is pretty swell.

name: drago25
text: Achewood: visit for the hilarity, stay for the striking prose and depth of character (and more hilarity).

name: deovalente
text: I get this feeling that the "OHHH SHIIIIIT!" in the last panel was screamed at the top of his lungs, and that made me all warm, fuzzy, and happy. Beef is yelling . Beef is yelling . Yelling with joy.

name: boopy
text: one of my favorites =]

name: lemminadetate
text: this strip really taught me something about relationships and anxiety toward them and such. Thanks Onstad.

name: paby
text: One of my favorites because every panel is perfect.

name: alzuna
text:
I love this, although this totally makes me want to call up my boyfriend of 4 years and propose, haha.

Proposing on the phone, all not doing it right, all awkward silence.

name: nickb285
text: So...did you do it?

name: alzuna
text: it was a text message actually and the results were hilarious.

name: nickb285
text: You are pretty much my hero.

name: philophobe
text: Oh, if only I could rate this a 50 for Beef's contented little smile in panels 6 and 8.

name: puguglypress
text: I didn't even notice "ZRRRRRRRRRRRRR" the first time I read it. It adds so much

text:
i thought a ufo was abducting him because of the ZRRRRRR and the light over him

it was confusing thank god it is over

name: atypicaloracle
text: Roast Beef's inner monologue with its Klein bottle of metaphor is my second favorite thing on this particular strip, surpassed only marginally by the awesome street light and darkness effect.

name: carlyle
text: That's just the kind of thing you've gotta yell of an abandoned bridge some time in your life, ya know?

name: thespoof
text: spent a couple minutes trying to line up the alt text with the speech bubble, then i realized it had too many "I's." ruined my fun
